desc_content.paragraph: A gym environment that connects to the iai server application running the simulation
Override close in your subclass to perform any necessary cleanup.
Environments will automatically close() themselves when garbage collected or when the program exits.
Returns the map of the scenario in OSM format
The set of supported modes varies per environment. (And some third-party environments may not support rendering at all.) By convention, if mode is:

list_item.paragraph: human: render to the current display or terminal and return nothing. Usually for human consumption.
rgb_array: Return an numpy.ndarray with shape (x, y, 3), representing RGB values for an x-by-y pixel image, suitable for turning into a video.
ansi: Return a string (str) or StringIO.StringIO containing a terminal-style text representation. The text can include newlines and ANSI escape sequences (e.g. for colors).

definition_list_item.term: Make sure that your class’s metadata ‘render_modes’ key includes

definition.paragraph: the list of supported modes. It’s recommended to call super() in implementations to use the functionality of this method.
mode (str): the mode to render with
return np.array(…) # return RGB frame suitable for video
… # pop up a window and render
super(MyEnv, self).render(mode=mode) # just raise an exception

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the current location of all agents
Accepts the next action of the ego vehicle and generates the next state of all the agents in the world :param action: :type action: :return: :rtype:
This is a module responsible for creating 3D bounding boxes and drawing them client-side on pygame surface.
Draws bounding boxes on the given image from the camera.
Base class for displays that does nothing with received image.
Disconnect from camera and close self. Can’t be restarted after destroying.
Detach from the camera and stop displaying.

list_item.paragraph: array (np.array of np.uint8) – Height by width by 3 (RGB color channels) image array.
offset – Position of the top left corner in screen coordinates to start rendering from. Subclasses may ignore it if not supported.

desc_content.paragraph: Change own resolution and reconnect to the camera, so it can adjust the images sent.
Restart the display, reconnecting to last used camera.
Stop the display, remembering the camera connected to but disconnecting from it.
Indicates an attempt to use a sensor that is not instantiated in any world.
PyGame window displayed on the monitor. Using fake display with pygame will make it invisible. The window is necessary to capture key strokes.

list_item.paragraph: array (np.array of np.uint8) – Height by width by 3 (RGB color channels) image array.
offset – Position of the top left corner in screen coordinates to start rendering from. Subclasses may ignore it if not supported.

desc_content.paragraph: Resize to new resolution. Underlying PyGame implementation is not very reliable.
Create a smaller screen from a part of this one.

desc_signature.desc_annotation: = {'boundingbox': {'attach_to_actor': 'ego', 'frame_of_reference': 'carla', 'location': Location(x=0, y=0, z=0), 'occlusion': False, 'radius': 100000, 'rotation': Rotation(yaw=0, pitch=0, roll=0), 'sensor_type': 'boundingbox', 'track_actor_types': ['vehicles', 'pedestrians', 'traffic-lights', 'parked_vehicles'], 'world_sensor': False}, 'camera': {'bounding_box': True, 'camera_type': 'rgb-camera', 'fov': 90.0, 'location': Location(x=1.6, y=0, z=1.7), 'resolution': Resolution(width=200, height=88), 'rotation': Rotation(yaw=0, pitch=0, roll=0), 'sensor_type': 'camera', 'show_bounding_boxes': True, 'track_actor_types': ['vehicles', 'pedestrians', 'traffic-lights', 'parked_vehicles'], 'world_sensor': False}}

desc_content.paragraph: A split screen display uses a part of a larger display. Can only be used on displays that allow rendering with offset.

list_item.paragraph: offset ((int, int)) – Left right corner of this display in pixels of parent display.
parent (Display) – Larger display to use a part of.
array (np.array of np.uint8) – Height by width by 3 (RGB color channels) image array.
offset – Position of the top left corner in screen coordinates to start rendering from. Subclasses may ignore it if not supported.

desc_content.paragraph: The concrete class that handles handshaking and other communications to the zmq server
This class provides methods for establishing connections with the client and exchanging data using flatbuffers for serialization of data
